abstract.para: The topic explains who can log in to &cockpit; and how to switch to elevated privilege tasks.

topic.para: You do not need separate credentials to log in to &cockpit;. Use the same credentials that you use to log in to &productname;. However, on new installations, login using &rootuser; is not allowed by default. Either enable &rootuser; login with a password as described in , or create an unprivileged user to access &cockpit;. On instances upgraded from a previous release, &rootuser; login is still allowed. In all cases, we recommend enhancing the security by adding 2FA as described in .
At first, you log in to &cockpit; with limited access. To perform administrative tasks, click Limited access in the upper-right menu and unlock the administrative mode by entering your password.
